RelatedSentence: India 's rupee climbed to an 11 - month high , after last week 's 2.1 percent rally that was the world 's best performance , as the nation 's clearest election results in three decades boosted investor confidence .
Narendra Modi 's Bharatiya Janata Party won 282 of 543 parliamentary seats , more than the 272 needed to form a government , according to the Election Commission .

The BJP has garnered the nation 's first single - party majority since 1984 and that 's boosting bets the new administration will pursue policies to improve the economy without being constrained by coalition politics , according to Deutsche Bank AG .

The BJP has garnered the nation 's first single - party majority since 1984 and that 's boosting bets the new administration will pursue policies to improve the economy without being constrained by coalition politics , according to Deutsche Bank AG .
The rupee rose on the back of victory for the BJP with a majority , analysts at Angel Broking Ltd. , including Anish Vyas in Mumbai , wrote in a research report today .
Any sharp upside in the currency will be capped due to dollar demand from oil importers and the central bank , they wrote .
The currency rose 0.5 percent today to 58.4975 per dollar as of 9:35 a.m. in Mumbai , according to prices from local banks compiled by Bloomberg .
It touched 58.4750 earlier , the strongest level since June 18 .

One - month implied volatility , a gauge of expected moves in the exchange rate used to price options , fell 31 basis points , or 0.31 percentage point , today to 8.34 percent , according to data compiled by Bloomberg .
, the second-most accurate rupee forecaster in the last four quarters , sees the currency rising toward 57 per dollar by year - end , while Mirae Asset Management Co. predicts a rally to 55 .

While the election results have buoyed optimism about India 's policies , the central bank may restrain exchange - rate gains that would threaten the nation 's exports , Sameer Goel , Deutsche Bank 's head of Asian interest - rate and foreign - exchange research in Singapore , said in a telephone interview on May 16 .

Three - month offshore non-deliverable forwards rose 0.3 percent to 59.37 per dollar , according to data compiled by Bloomberg .
